comments.html: Seems like they fell 13.0 doesn't lucky for them and 14 just not big enough so they choice 15.0. Well if I not mistaken every new features from 12.4T and 12.4 special releases merged to 15.0 but anything else?
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html: Why they've skipped 13.0 is obvious ;) 14 has a similar meaning in East Asia (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tetraphobia). It looks like 15.0 is primarily a merge, but there are a few new goodies ... just give me some time to test them  8-)
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: I've just tested a 7200 image with Dynamips, it still seems to work :)
comments.name: chris

comments.html:
Another big win is finally being able to install SSH RSA Public keys in the router, for (semi-)passwordless logins.

I'm not sure the DMVPN if-state monitoring guff is perfect yet (i had to shut/no-shut the tunnel yesterday on my test router to bring it back up), but looks interesting.

Oh, and IPS is now forcibly licensed (no surprise, given the existence of those "with IPS" maintenance SKUs already).

Did you also notice the 1900/2900/3900-series routers on the software download page?
comments.name: Andrew Cosgriff

comments.html: I guess the SSH RSA feature was added to the feature list after I've discovered it. I wouldn't have missed something like that ;)
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
You may or may not also have noticed the UNANNOUNCED NEW ROUTER MODELS, which use 15.0(1)M:

1941
2901 2911 2921 2951
3925 3945

=-O
comments.name: Sam Crooks

comments.html: Hey Chris, what image did you get working? I just tried c7200p-adventerprisek9-mz.150-1.M.bin in GNS3 and it didn't boot?
comments.name: Paul

comments.html: Still no joy with running c7200p-advipservicesk9-mz.150-1.M.bin in GNS3. Is this what you are running? Have you needed to adjust any of the memory settings to get it to boot? I seem to get “209-unable to start VM instance ‘gost-c7200p-advipservicesk9-mz.150-1.M.bin-localhost.ghost’. Are you running GNS3 on Windows? 7200 12.4 code is fine. Thanks
comments.name: Paul

comments.html: Dynagen on Linux. I wouldn't touch GNS3 ... I hate using GUI where CLI can do what I need ;)
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: You took an NPE-G2 image (c7200p-*), I'm not sure it will work correctly. Try with a MIPS image (c7200-*).
comments.name: chris

comments.html: Cheers Chris, c7200-advipservicesk9-mz.150-1.M.bin worked fine. P.S. Ivan - GNS3 rocks! :)
comments.name: Paul

comments.html: Haven't checked the other ones, but the 1941 seems to be EOS?
comments.name: DirkW

comments.html: Guess they just scrapped the "2." from the "train-name" so while the next IOS train would have been the 12.5.x you now have 1[2.]5.x = 15.x
comments.name: DirkW

comments.html: Cisco 2811 - Traffic Shaping doesn't work. Traffic Shaping statistics is not displayed. Higher CPU load.
comments.name: Aleksandr Okonnikov

comments.html:
Hi, DirkW

MWR 1941 was EoS since 2003. Last support 2009

ISR1941 is the new one.
